*   Aktwal o digital na dokumentasyon ng form ng pagbabakuna mula sa isang provider ng pangangalagang pangkalusugan o iba pang issuer.
*   [Digital na Talaan ng Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record, DCVR). 

Basahin ang [Mga Alituntunin at Pamantayan sa Talaan ng Bakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) ng CDPH para sa kumpletong detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Ano ang ibig sabihin ng “ganap nang nabakunahan”?
Answer:
Itinuturing na kumpleto na sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ang mga tao:

*   Dalawang linggo matapos niyang matanggap ang pangalawang dosis sa isang seryeng may 2 dosis (Pfizer or Moderna), o
*   Dalawang linggo matapos niyang matanggap ang bakunang may iisang dosis lang (Johnson and Johnson/Janssen).

Tingnan ang [Mga Rekomendasyon sa Pampublikong Kalusugan para sa Mga Taong Kumpleto sa Bakuna sa Panahon ng COVID-19 (COVID-19 Public Health Recommendations for Fully Vaccinated People)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/COVID-19-Public-Health-Recommendations-for-Fully-Vaccinated-People.aspx) ng CDPH para sa mga detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Magpopositibo ba ako sa COVID-19 dahil sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Hindi. Hindi ka magpopositibo sa [mga pagsusuri ng virus](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/diagnostic-testing.html) dahil sa isang bakuna.

Kung makakagawa ang iyong katawan ng immune response, puwede kang magpositibo sa [mga pagsusuri sa antibody](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/serology-overview.html). Ipinapakita nitong posibleng mayroon kang proteksyon laban sa virus.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano mapoprotektahan ang aking privacy kung magpapabakuna ako laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Lubos na pinaghihigpitan ng batas ng California kung paano puwedeng ibahagi ang personal na impormasyon tungkol sa mga magpapabakuna. Nakipagnegosasyon ang California sa pederal na pamahalaan para malimitahan sa impormasyon lang na hindi magbibigay ng pagkakakilanlan ng indibidwal ang kinakailangang pagbabahagi ng data.

Magbasa pa sa [Kasunduan sa Paggamit ng Data ng California at Mga Madalas Itanong](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/California-Data-Use-Agreement.aspx) ng CDPH.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Dapat ko bang itabi ang aking COVID-19 vaccination record card?
Answer:
Oo. Itabi ang iyong card ng talaan sa pagbabakuna sa isang ligtas na lugar para hindi ito mawala o masira

Makakakuha sa portal ng [Digital na Talaan ng Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record, DCVR) ng digital na kopya ng talaang ito. Kung nawala mo ang iyong papel na card, i-print out ang digital na talaan mo. Puwede mo itong gamitin sa anumang lugar kung saan maipapakita mo ang iyong papel na card.

Basahin ang [Mga Alituntunin at Pamantayan sa Talaan ng Bakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) ng CDPH para sa kumpletong detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kailangan ba ng mga provider ng pahintulot ng magulang bago magturok ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 sa isang menor de edad?
Answer:
Oo. Bago magbakuna ng isang menor de edad, dapat munang humingi ang mga provider ng bakuna ng pahintulot mula sa isang:

*   Magulang, 
*   Legal na tagapangalaga, o 
*   Iba pang nasa hustong gulang na may legal na kustodiya. 

May ilang pagbubukod:

*   Hindi kailangan ng [mga emancipated minor](https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displaySection.xhtml?lawCode=FAM&sectionNum=7050.) ng pahintulot ng magulang o tagapag-alaga para makatanggap ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.
*   Puwedeng tumanggap ang mga provider ng nakasulat na pahintulot mula sa isang magulang o legal na tagapag-alaga ng isang unaccompanied minor. Dapat kumpirmahin ng pahintulot na ito na natanggap ng magulang/tagapag-alaga ang [Sheet ng Impormasyon sa EUA ng Pfizer](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download).
*   Katanggap-tanggap ang pahintulot sa pamamagitan ng telepono o video. Dapat kumpirmahin ng magulang/tagapag-alaga na natanggap niya ang [Sheet ng Impormasyon sa EUA ng Pfizer](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download). Puwede ring basahin ang sheet ng impormasyon sa magulang/tagapangalaga.

Dapat tanungin ng mga pamilya ang kanilang provider ng bakuna tungkol sa mga tinatanggap ng form ng pahintulot. Tingnan ang [Gabay sa Pahintulot sa Menor de Edad para sa Bakuna ng Pfizer](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-Vaccine-Minor-Consent-Guidance.aspx) ng CDPH para sa higit pang detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Bakit ko dapat pabakunahan ang aking anak?
Answer:
Tumataas ang mga kaso sa mga bata. 22% na ngayon ang kabataan sa mga bagong kaso ng COVID-19 sa U.S., ayon sa [American Academy of Pediatrics (PDF)](https://downloads.aap.org/AAP/PDF/AAP%20and%20CHA%20-%20Children%20and%20COVID-19%20State%20Data%20Report%204.29.21%20FINAL.pdf). Sa parehong panahon noong nakaraang taon, 3% lang ito. Mahalagang pabakunahan ang mga bata para maiwasan ang pagtaas ng bilang ng mga bagong kaso.

Puwedeng mapigilan ng pagbabakuna ang pagkalat ng mga variant ng coronavirus. Puwede rin nitong mabawasan ang bilang ng mga taong madaling mahawahan ng COVID-19. Sa pamamagitan ng pagbabakuna sa mga 12 hanggang 15 taong gulang, mas magiging ligtas ang mga pamilya habang bumabalik tayo sa mga bagay na gusto nating gawin.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Nagkaroon na ang aking anak ng mga reaksyon sa ibang bakuna. Dapat pa rin ba niyang kunin ang bakuna?
Answer: Oo, maliban na lang kung nagkaroon na sila ng mga anaphylactic na uri ng reaksyon sa mga sangkap ng bakuna ng Pfizer. Bihira lang ang mga allergic na reaksyon sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19. Kung nagkaroon na ang iyong anak ng mga malalang allergy o reaksyon sa bakuna laban sa trangkaso, kausapin ang kanyang doktor bago siya pabakunahan. \n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Mayroon bang mas mataas na panganib sa pagpapabakuna para sa mga batang may dati nang kundisyon tulad ng hika?
Answer: Ang mga batang 12 hanggang 15 taong gulang ay puwede pa ring makatanggap ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 kahit mayroon silang mga kundisyon sa kalusugan. Kausapin ang iyong doktor o klinika tungkol sa mga partikular na kundisyon ng iyong anak.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kakailanganin bang magpabakuna ng aking anak bago siya bumalik sa personal na pag-aaral?
Answer: Hindi. Hindi kinakailangang magpabakuna sa ngayon para makabalik sa personal na pagkatuto. Pero layunin ng estado na maraming mabakunahang 2.1 milyong 12 hanggang 15 taong gulang bago ang taglagas. Mapoprotektahan ng bakuna ang mga bata at teenager mula sa mga mas nakakahawang variant ng coronavirus at COVID-19.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Bakit para lang sa mga kabataan na 12 taong gulang pataas ang bakuna? Kailan magiging available ang mga bakuna sa mga bata?
Answer:
Ang mga pagsubok ng bakuna ay nagsisimula sa mas nakakatanda at mas bulnerableng populasyon, at sinusunod dito ang mga mas batang edad. Mga teenager ang sunod na binigyang-priyoridad dahil sila ang pinakakatulad ng mga nasa hustong gulang. Bukod pa rito, mas malaki ang posibilidad nila, kaysa sa mga bata, na maikalat ang virus at magkaroon ng malalang sakit. Binabalanse ng pamamaraang ito ang pangangailangang maging ligtas at mabilis, habang pinoprotektahan ang ating mga anak.

Ang Pfizer at Moderna ay may kasalukuyang klinikal na pagsubok sa mga batang may edad na 12 taong gulang pababa. Kung walang magiging problema, puwedeng gawin sa bandang dulo ng taong ito ang pagpapahintulot para sa susunod na hanay na ito ng edad. Kasalukuyang nagsasagawa ang Johnson & Johnson ng mga klinikal na pagsubok para sa saklaw ng edad na 12-17 taong gulang.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Isa akong employer at gusto kong tulungan ang aking mga empleyado na mabakunahan. Paano ko ito magagawa?
Answer:
Nakasaad sa [Toolkit ng Employer sa Pagbabakuna](https://saferatwork.covid19.ca.gov/employer-vaccination-toolkit/) ang lahat ng impormasyong kailangan mo para:

*   Makipag-partner sa mga lokal na provider para sa mga offsite na event sa pagbabakuna
*   Humiling ng worksite na mobile na klinika
*   Tulungan ang mga empleyado na makahanap at mag-book ng mga appointment sa pagbabakuna
*   Magbahagi at mag-promote ng mga resource na sumusuporta sa mga empleyado sa pagpapabakuna

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede bang iutos ng isang employer ang pagpapabakuna laban sa COVID-19 para sa lahat ng empleyadong pumapasok sa trabaho?
Answer:
Oo, kung natutugunan ang ilang partikular na ipinag-aatas. Sa ilalim ng ADA, posibleng atasan ng employer ang lahat ng empleyado na matugunan ang isang pamantayang nauugnay sa trabaho at naaayon sa pangangailangan ng negosyo. Puwedeng may kasama itong pamantayang nauugnay sa kaligtasan, na nangangailangan ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.  

Pero kung hindi matutugunan ng isang empleyado ang isang pamantayan dahil sa isang kapansanan, puwedeng hindi siya atasan ng employer na sumunod. Ang pagbubukod roon ay kung banta sa kalusugan o kaligtasan ng empleyado o ng ibang tao sa lugar ng trabaho ang hindi pagsunod ng nasabing empleyado.

Para sa higit pang detalye, basahin ang [Ang Dapat Mong Malaman Tungkol sa COVID-19 at ADA, ang Batas sa Rehabilitasyon (Rehabilitation Act), at iba pang Batas sa Patas na Oportunidad sa Trabaho (Equal Employment Opportunity, EEO)](https://www.eeoc.gov/wysk/what-you-should-know-about-covid-19-and-ada-rehabilitation-act-and-other-eeo-laws).

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kinakailangan bang mabakunahan ang mga taong may mga partikular na trabaho?
Answer:
Oo. Sa California, kasama rito ang mga manggagawa sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan, nagtatrabaho sa mga congregate na lugar, empleyado ng estado, at K-12 na guro at staff ng paaralan.

Dapat ay may kumpletong bakuna ang **mga manggagawa sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan at nagtatrabaho sa mga congregate na lugar** (tulad ng mga shelter para sa walang matirhan at koreksyonal na pasilidad). Makakagawa lang ng mga pagbubukod para sa mga taong may:

*   Mga salungat na paniniwala sa relihiyon, o
*   Mga kwalipikadong medikal na dahilan. 

Kung hindi sila kumpleto sa bakuna, inaatasan silang regular na magpasuri para sa COVID-19 at magsuot ng mask o iba pang personal na pamproteksyong kagamitan (personal protective equipment, PPE) sa trabaho. Magbasa pa sa: 

*   [Mga Tanong at Sagot Tungkol sa Kinakailangan sa Bakuna ng Mga Manggagawa sa Pangangalagang Pangkalusugan](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/FAQ-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx)
*   [Mga Tanong at Sagot Tungkol sa Proteksyon sa Mga Lugar na May Malaking Panganib](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Unvaccinated-Workers-in-High-Risk-Settings-State-Public-Health-Order-FAQ.aspx)

Kumpleto rin dapat sa bakuna o regular din dapat na magpasuri para sa COVID-19 ang **mga empleyado ng estado ng California**. Tingnan ang mga detalye sa [Pagberipika ng Bakuna at Mga Kinakailangan sa Pagsusuri ng CalHR (PDF)](https://www.calhr.ca.gov/Documents/Vaccine-Verification-and-Testing-Requirements.pdf).

Dapat beripikahin ng **mga K-12 na guro at empleyado ng paaralan** sa California na [kumpleto sila sa bakuna, o dapat silang lingguhang magpabakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Vaccine-Verification-for-Workers-in-Schools.aspx) para sa COVID-19.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kung magpapabakuna ako para sa COVID-19, kakailanganin ko pa rin bang magpabakuna para sa trangkaso ngayong taglagas?
Answer: Oo. Hindi nagbibigay ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng proteksyon laban sa trangkaso.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Mayroon bang ilang partikular na populasyon na hindi dapat magpabakuna para sa COVID-19? Paano naman ang mga taong may mga allergy?
Answer:
[Inirerekomenda ng CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html) na:

*   Kung nagkaroon ka na ng malala o agarang reaksyon sa anumang sangkap sa isang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 na gawa sa mRNA, huwag kunin ang bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna. Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Janssen.
*   Kung nagkaroon ka na ng malala o agarang reaksyon sa anumang sangkap sa bakuna ng Janssen laban sa COVID-19, huwag kunin ang bakuna ng Janssen. Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.
*   Kung nagkaroon ka ng agarang allergic na reaksyon pagkatapos ng unang dosis ng isang bakuna para sa COVID-19, huwag kunin ang pangalawang dosis.  
*   Kung allergic ka sa PEG, hindi mo dapat kunin ang bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna. Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Janssen.
*   Kung may allergy ka sa polysorbate, hindi dapat magpaturok ng bakuna ng Janssen. Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.

Puwedeng magpabakuna ang mga taong may mga dati nang medikal na kundisyon, basta't hindi sila [allergic sa mga sangkap ng bakuna](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html). Matuto pa tungkol sa mga pagsasaalang-alang sa pagbabakuna [para sa mga taong may mga dati nang medikal na kundisyon](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/underlying-conditions.html).

Para matuto tungkol sa mga sangkap sa mga awtorisadong bakuna laban sa COVID-19, tingnan ang

*   [Impormasyon tungkol sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Pfizer-BioNTech](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Pfizer-BioNTech.html)
*   [Impormasyon tungkol sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Moderna](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Moderna.html)
*   [Impormasyon Tungkol sa Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 ng Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/janssen.html)

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kung buntis o nagpapasuso ako, dapat ba akong magpabakuna para sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Oo. Ayon sa CDC, puwedeng tumanggap ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ang mga buntis at nagpapasusong indibidwal. Walang alalahanin sa kaligtasan ng pagbabakuna ang mga eksperto para sa mga buntis o nagpapasusong babae o sa kanilang mga pinapasusong sanggol. Ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ay walang buhay na virus, kaya hindi makakapagdulot ng COVID-19 ang mga ito.

Ang mga buntis na tao ay mas malamang na magkaroon ng malubhang karamdaman dahil sa COVID-19 kaysa sa mga hindi buntis. Ang pagpapaturok ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 sa panahon ng pagbubuntis ay puwedeng magprotekta sa iyo mula sa malubhang karamdaman. Makipag-usap sa iyong doktor kung mayroon kang mga tanong tungkol sa pagpapaturok ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.

Para sa higit pang impormasyon, basahin ang:

*   [Mga Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 Habang Buntis o Nagpapasuso ng Sanggol](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/pregnancy.html) ng CDC
*   [Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 at Pagbubuntis (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/COVID-19-Vaccine-and-Pregnancy.pdf) ng CDPH

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Gaano katagal ako dapat maghintay bago ko kunin ang bakuna pagkatapos kong magkaroon ng COVID-19?
Answer:
Inirerekomenda ng [CDC ang sumusunod:](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fcovid-19%2Finfo-by-product%2Fpfizer%2Fclinical-considerations.html)

*   Kung ikaw ay nagpositibo, may mga hindi malalang sintomas, at hindi ginamot para sa coronavirus, dapat kang:
    *   Maghintay ng hindi bababa sa 10 araw pagkatapos magsimula ang mga sintomas ng COVID-19, at 
    *   Tugunan ang [mga pamantayan sa paghinto sa pag-isolate](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html) bago kunin ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19.
*   Maghintay ng 90 araw bago kunin ang bakuna kung:
    *   Kagagaling mo lang mula sa pagkakahawa ng COVID-19, at  
    *   Ginamot ka gamit ang mga monoclonal antibody o convalescent plasma.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede ko bang kunin ang bakuna para sa COVID-19 kasabay ng ibang bakuna?
Answer: Oo, puwede kang magpabakuna para sa COVID-19 at kumuha ng iba pang bakuna (gaya ng para sa trangkaso) sa iisang pagbisita. Hindi mo na kailangang maghintay nang 14 na araw pagkatapos ng ibang bakuna. Matuto pa tungkol sa [pagkuha ng mahigit sa isang uri ng bakuna](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html#Coadministration).\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede ba akong pumili sa pagitan ng iba't ibang bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer: Oo. Sa [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) at [VaccineFinder](https://vaccinefinder.org/search/), makakapaghanap ka ng mga bakuna ayon sa manufacturer.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Mandatoryo ba ang mga bakuna para sa COVID-19?
Answer: Hindi. Hindi ka inaatasan ng estado o pederal na pamahalaan na magpabakuna. Umaasa kaming pipiliin ng mga Californian na magpabakuna kapag nakita na nila kung gaano ito kaligtas at kaepektibo.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kailangan ko bang magpabakuna para bumisita sa isang pasilidad sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan?
Answer:
Oo. Ang mga bumibisita sa mga ospital, sanay na pasilidad sa pangangalaga, at pasilidad sa intermediate care ay dapat magpakita ng patunay na mayroon silang kumpletong bakuna. Kung hindi kumpleto ang kanilang bakuna, puwede lang silang makabisita kung magpapakita sila ng patunay ng negatibong pagsusuri sa COVID-19 sa nakalipas na 72 oras.  
  
Ang lahat ng bisita, anuman ang kanilang status sa pagpapabakuna, ay dapat magsuot ng mask at naaangkop na PPE at magpanatili ng social distance sa kanilang pagbisita. Magbasa pa tungkol sa [Mga Kinakailangan para sa Mga Bisita sa Mga Setting ng Acute na Pangangalagang Pangkalusugan at Pangmatagalang Pangangalaga](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings.aspx) ng CDPH.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano ko makukumbinsi ang aking pamilya at mga kaibigan na magpabakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Posibleng maging mahirap ang pakikipag-usap sa pamilya at mga kaibigan tungkol sa mga benepisyo ng pagpapabakuna laban sa COVID-19. Subukang makinig nang walang panghuhusga at tukuyin ang ugat ng kanilang mga alalahanin. Kasama sa mga bagay na dapat tandaan para makatulong sa pagbubukas ng talakayan ang:

*   Pakikinig sa mga tanong nang may pang-unawa
*   Pagtatanong ng mga tanong na walang iisang sagot para matuklasan ang mga alalahanin
*   Paghingi ng pahintulot para magbahagi ng impormasyon
*   Pagtulong sa kanilang malaman ang kanilang sariling dahilan para magpabakuna
*   Tulungan na mangyari ang kanilang pagpapabakuna

Basahin ang [Paano kausapin ang mga kaibigan at kapamilya tungkol sa mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 (How to talk about COVID-19 vaccines with friends and family)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/talk-about-vaccines.html?ACSTrackingID=USCDC_2067-DM52837&ACSTrackingLabel=How%20to%20Talk%20to%20Family%20and%20Friends%20about%20COVID-19%20Vaccines%20%7C%20COVID-19&deliveryName=USCDC_2067-DM52837) ng CDC.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Ligtas ba ang mga bakuna para sa mga bata na 12 hanggang 15 taong gulang?
Answer: Ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Pfizer ay [awtorisado ng FDA](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use) para sa mga batang may edad na 12 taon pataas. Napag-alaman na ligtas at epektibo ito sa pagprotekta ng mga batang 12 taong gulang sa mga klinikal na pagsubok.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano umeepekto ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer: Tinuturuan ng mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ang ating mga immune system kung paano labanan ang virus na nagdudulot ng COVID-19. Inaabot nang ilang linggo matapos ang pagbabakuna bago maging immune ang katawan sa virus. Ibig sabihin, puwede ka pa ring mahawahan ng COVID-19 pagkatapos mong magpabakuna. \n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Gaano katagal may mga incentive card? Hanggang kailan ang programa?
Answer: Naging available lang ang mga card sa unang 2 milyong kwalipikadong indibidwal na nagsimulang magpabakuna noong Mayo 27 hanggang Hulyo 18.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Kung nakuha ko na ang aking dosis bago magsimula ang programa sa incentive card, at kukunin ko ang aking pangalawang dosis pagkatapos nitong magsimula, kwalipikado ba ako?
Answer: Hindi, hindi ka naging kwalipikadong makatanggap ng incentive card. Pero naging kwalipikado ka para sa iba pang cash at bakasyong papremyo. Layunin ng programa sa card na hikayatin ang mga hindi pa nababakunahang Californian na magpabakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Makakatanggap ba ako ng $50 na incentive card kung nakumpleto ko ang aking bakuna bago magsimula ang programa?
Answer: Hindi. Layunin ng programa sa incentive card na hikayatin ang mga natitirang Californian na magpabakuna. Gayunpaman, naging kwalipikado para sa iba pang cash at bakasyong papremyo ang mga Californian na kumpleto na sa bakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ko makukuha ang aking redemption code?
Answer:
Kung sinimulan mong magpabakuna noong Mayo 27 hanggang Hulyo 18, makakakuha ka ng redemption code sa pamamagitan ng text o email sa loob ng 7-10 araw pagkatapos ng huli mong bakuna. Para sa mga tatanggap ng seryeng may dalawang dosis, itatabi ang iyong $50 na card hanggang sa makuha mo ang iyong pangalawang dosis.

*   Kung wala kang mobile phone o email address, 7-10 araw pagkatapos ng iyong bakuna, puwede kang tumawag sa [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873) para makatanggap ng aktwal na card.
*   Kung wala kang permanenteng address, 7-10 araw pagkatapos ng iyong bakuna, tumawag sa [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873) para isaayos ang paghahatid ng iyong $50 na card.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Gaano katagal bago matanggap ang incentive card pagkatapos itong i-redeem?
Answer: Inaabot nang hanggang limang araw ng negosyo bago matanggap ang incentive card. Kung hindi mo natanggap ang iyong card pagkalipas ng limang araw ng negosyo, tumawag sa [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano mapapatunayan ng mga taong tapos na sila sa dalawang dosis? Paano kung may susubok na mandaya sa pamamagitan ng pekeng card ng bakuna?
Answer: Ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ay sinusubaybayan sa mga talaan sa pagbabakuna ng California. Ibibigay ang mga incentive card at iba pang cash na papremyo batay sa mga talaang iyon.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano kung nagpabakuna ako, pero hindi ko natanggap ang aking code?
Answer: Kung hindi ka makakatanggap ng code pagkalipas ng 14 na araw, tumawag sa [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: May pagpipilian ba sa mga incentive card?
Answer:
Oo, may tatlong pagpipilian:

1.  Virtual Mastercard®: Hindi ATM card kaya hindi ito puwedeng i-cash out. Puwede itong i-redeem online sa mga lugar na tumatanggap ng Debit Mastercard®. Isa itong virtual na incentive card, at puwede itong idagdag sa mobile wallet sa telepono.
2.  Kroger: Good at Ralphs, Food 4 Less, at Foods Co. Inirerekomenda naming i-print ang card, dahil hindi lahat ng grocery ay may kakayahang i-scan ito sa telepono. _(Tandaan: Hindi tumatanggap ng card bilang bayad ang ilang Food 4 Less na tindahan sa Northern California at sa Central Coast. _Tingnan ang_ [_listahang ito ng mga kalahok na lokasyon ng Kroger_ (PDF)](https://files.covid19.ca.gov/pdf/Ralphs-Food4Less-FoodsCo-CA-list.pdf)_._)_
3.  Albertsons: Good at Safeway, Albertsons, Vons, Pavilions, at Andronico's Community Market. Inirerekomenda naming i-print ang card, dahil hindi lahat ng grocery ay may kakayahang i-scan ito sa telepono.

Available habang may supply. Kung wala ka pang 18 taong gulang, kailangan ay may magulang o tagapangalaga ka na kukumpleto sa proseso ng pagpili ng card para sa iyo, maliban na lang kung isa kang emancipated na menor de edad.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nag-e-expire ba ang aking redemption code?
Answer: Oo. Dapat mong gamitin ang redemption code sa loob ng 90 araw para ma-claim ang iyong card. Kapag na-claim na ito, mag-e-expire ang Virtual Mastercard® pagkalipas ng 12 buwan. Hindi nag-e-expire ang mga grocery card.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Ano ang kinailangan kong gawin para makasali sa mga draw?
Answer: Kinailangan lang na sa California ka nagpabakuna para sa COVID-19 bago nag-draw ng mga panalo. Hindi kinailangan ng form sa pagsali; awtomatiko kang naisali sa draw batay sa mga talaan para sa pagbabakuna ng California nang ibigay ng iyong tagapagbakuna ang impormasyon mo sa registry para sa pagbabakuna ng estado. Isinaalang-alang ang mga bakuna Pfizer, Moderna, o Johnson & Johnson man ang kinuha mo. Nakatira ka dapat sa California para manalo. Makukuha ng nanalo ang papremyo kapag nakumpleto na niya ang serye ng kanyang bakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ako makakapag-book ng appointment para sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer: Puwede kang magpaiskedyul ng mga appointment o maghanap ng mga walk-in na klinika sa [myturn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov). Puwede mo ring gamitin ang iba pang website o hotline na ibinibigay ng CDC o mga lokal na departamento ng kalusugan. Puwede ring magpa-appointment sa pamamagitan ng pagtawag sa Hotline para sa COVID-19 ng California sa [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano kung magpabakuna ako sa labas ng My Turn system ng California?
Answer: Hindi kailangang sa pamamagitan ng My Turn ka magpabakuna para maging kwalipikado ka. Kwalipikado ka pa rin kung ang lugar ng iyong pagbabakuna ay nasa California, at iniuulat nito ang mga ibinigay nitong dosis sa estado.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano kung pinili kong hindi ibahagi ang aking data sa Mga System ng Impormasyon Tungkol sa Pagbabakuna (IIS)?
Answer: Iuulat pa rin ang data sa estado, kaya kwalipikado ka pa rin sa incentive at iba pang cash na papremyo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano inabisuhan ang mga nanalo?
Answer:
Pinoprotektahan ng estado ang iyong privacy, at may mga ginagawa itong hakbang para maprotektahan ang mga Californian mula sa mga scam. Ang mga nanalo ay inabisuhan ng mga opisyal ng Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California (California Department of Public Health, CDPH) sa pamamagitan ng opisyal na caller ID na "Estado ng CA CDPH," text, email address ng CDPH, o nang personal ng mga staff ng distrito ng CDPH. CDPH lang ang nakakaalam sa pagkakakilanlan ng taong nauugnay sa nabunot na random na numero. Para sa higit pang impormasyon, tingnan ang [Mga Tuntunin at Kundisyon](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vax-Win-Terms.aspx).

Ang mga nanalo ay hindi pinagbayad ng anumang singil na nauugnay sa pagkumpirma ng pagiging kwalipikado para sa cash na papremyo. Dapat iulat sa [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) o [1-833-993-3873](tel:833-993-3873) ang anumang mapanlokong aktibidad o maling impormasyon. Puwede ring gamitin ng mga indibidwal ang nasabing email address o numero ng telepono sa pag-uulat ng anumang alalahanin tungkol sa kung totoo ba ang anumang pakikipag-ugnayan sa kanila kaugnay ng mga cash na pampremyo.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Isinapubliko ba ninyo ang mga pangalan ng mga nanalo?
Answer: Walang inanunsyong pangalan sa panahon ng pag-draw. Puwedeng tanggihan ng mga mananalo ang premyo, o tanggihan nila ang publicity na nauugnay sa premyo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Kailangan bang mamamayan ng U.S. ang isang tao para manalo?
Answer:
Hindi. Ang pagiging kwalipikado ay hindi ibinatay sa status sa immigration. Ito lang ang mga pamantayang kailangang matugunan ng mga kwalipikadong manalo:

*   Nakatira sa California,
*   May edad na 12 taon pataas,
*   At nakatanggap na ng hindi bababa sa isang dosis ng kanyang bakuna laban sa COVID-19.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Sino ang hindi naging kwalipikado?
Answer:
Hindi ka naging kwalipikado kung ikaw ay:

*   Isang empleyado ng ilang partikular na ahensya ng pamahalaan, o kung may kamag-anak kang ganito, 
*   Mga nakakulong,
*   Nakatira sa labas ng California, o
*   Nagpabakuna sa labas ng California. 

Ibibigay ang premyo pagkatapos makumpleto ng nanalo ang serye ng kanyang bakuna.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nakatanggap ako ng tawag tungkol sa Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo), na mukhang panloloko. Ano ang dapat kong gawin?
Answer:
Ang mga nanalo ay inabisuhan ng Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California at hindi pinagbayad ng anumang singil na nauugnay sa pagkumpirma ng pagiging kwalipikado para sa cash na papremyo.

Dapat iulat sa [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) o [1-833-993-3873](tel:833-993-3873) ang anumang mapanlokong aktibidad o maling impormasyon. Puwede ring gamitin ng mga indibidwal ang nasabing email address o numero ng telepono sa pag-uulat ng anumang alalahanin tungkol sa kung totoo ba ang anumang pakikipag-ugnayan sa kanila kaugnay ng mga cash na pampremyo.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nagbabahagi ba ng personal na impormasyong pangkalusugan sa mga programang ito ng incentive para sa bakuna?
Answer:
Hindi, hindi nagbabahagi ang mga programang ito ng personal na impormasyong pangkalusugan ng mga Californian. Tutulong ang Lottery sa mga programa, pero hindi ito makakatanggap ng impormasyong nagbibigay ng personal na pagkakakilanlan. Magiging anonymous ang lahat ng entry sa kanila.

Hindi ihahayag ang mga pangalan ng mga nanalo nang hindi sila nagbibigay ng pahintulot. Gayunpaman, puwedeng ianunsyo ang county ng nanalo. Titiyakin ng estado na magiging patas, matapat, at legal ang mga raffle, at na mapoprotektahan ang personal na impormasyon ng mga tao.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Sino ang nagbabayad sa programang ito?
Answer: Ang Estado ng California ang nagbabayad sa programang ito.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ibibigay ang premyo?
Answer: Ang lahat ng cash na papremyo ay papatawan ng buwis at ibibigay ng Opisina ng Tagakontrol ng Estado. Ang cash na papremyo ay kakaltasan din ng anumang hindi pa nababayarang buwis, bayad sa child support, o lien na hindi pa naibibigay ng nanalo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ipapamahagi ang Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer:
Pagkatapos tanggapin ng nanalo ang Dream Vacation, ibinigay ang kanyang pangalan at impormasyon sa pakikipag-ugnayan sa organizer ng biyaheng iyon. Nagsilbing travel liaison ang organizer para sa nanalo. Nakipag-ugnayan ang organizer sa nanalo sa loob ng limang araw ng negosyo mula sa pagtanggap niya ng premyo para magbigay ng mga detalye tungkol sa pag-redeem ng Dream Vacation. 

Ang mga organizing na kumpanya ay:

*   [Visit California](http://www.visitcalifornia.com/)
*   [San Francisco Travel Association](https://www.sftravel.com/)
*   [Greater Palm Springs Convention & Visitors Bureau](https://www.visitgreaterpalmsprings.com/)
*   [Visit Anaheim](https://www.visitanaheim.org/)
*   [Los Angeles Tourism & Convention Board](https://www.discoverlosangeles.com/)
*   [San Diego Tourism Authority](https://www.sandiego.org/)

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: May opsyon ba sa Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer:
Wala, iisa lang ang pinili para sa bawat isa sa anim na biyahe:

*   San Francisco (4 na tao sa loob ng 5 gabi)
*   Greater Palm Springs (2 tao sa loob ng 2 gabi)
*   Anaheim/Orange County (4 na tao sa loob ng 6 na gabi)
*   Los Angeles (4 na tao sa loob ng 3 gabi)
*   San Diego Beach (4 na tao sa loob ng 5 gabi)
*   San Diego Downtown (4 na tao sa loob ng 5 gabi)

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nag-e-expire ba ang Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer:
Oo. 

Dapat magamit ang Mga Dream Vacation sa Anaheim/Orange County at Dream Vacation sa San Diego bago ang Mayo 31, 2022. 

Dapat magamit ang Mga Dream Vacation sa San Francisco, Greater Palm Springs, at Los Angeles bago ang Hunyo 15, 2022.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Napapatawan ba ng buwis ang Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer: Oo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Ilang libreng ticket ang available at sino ang kwalipikado?
Answer: Magdo-donate ang Six Flags ng 50,000 libreng ticket sa sinumang Californian na makakatanggap ng kanyang unang dosis ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 sa mga kalahok na provider simula sa Hunyo 16, hangga't may supply.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Aling mga parke ang kwalipikado?
Answer: Magagamit ang mga ticket sa alinman sa apat na Six Flags park sa California - Six Flags Magic Mountain, Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Los Angeles, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, at Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Concord.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ko makukuha ang aking ticket?
Answer: Magbibigay ng mga aktwal na ticket sa lokasyon ng provider sa panahon ng pagbabakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Aling mga provider ang namimigay ng mga ticket at paano ako makakapagpa-appointment?
Answer: May 65 brick-and-mortar na lokasyon para sa pagbabakuna at ilang pop-up na lugar para sa pagbabakuna na mamimigay ng mga ticket sa pamamagitan ng 14 na organisasyon ng provider. Ang mga organisasyong mamamahagi ng mga bakuna ay ang Center for Family Health and Education, Chinatown Service Center, Clinica Sierra Vista, Mga Community Medical Center, Elica Health Center, JWCH Institute, Lifelong Health, UCI Family Health, Tiburcio Vasquez Health Center, at St. John’s Well Child and Family Centers. Mamamahagi rin ng mga ticket sa mga piling lokasyon ang Kaiser Permanente, Dignity Health, Curative, at Color Health. Kasama sa mga county na sakop ng mga pinagseserbisyuhang lugar ang Alameda, Contra Costa, Kern, Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside, Sacramento, San Bernardino, San Joaquin, Solano, Tulare, Ventura, Yolo, at Yuba. Tingnan ang [kumpletong listahan ng mga kalahok na lokasyon](/vax-for-the-win-six-flags).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Kailan nagsimulang mamahagi ng mga ticket ang mga kalahok na provider?
Answer: Nagsimulang mamahagi ang mga kalahok na provider ng mga ticket sa mga indibidwal na kakatapos lang magpabakuna sa Miyerkules, Hunyo 16, pagkatapos ng anunsyo ni Gobernador Gavin Newsom.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Ano ang mga tuntunin at kundisyon ng mga ticket?
Answer: May bisa ang mga ticket hanggang Setyembre 6 sa alinman sa apat na Six Flags park sa California - Six Flags Magic Mountain, Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Los Angeles, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, at Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Concord. Ang mga ticket ay hindi transferrable at hindi puwedeng muling ibenta. Made-deactivate ang ticket kung susubukang muling ibenta ang ticket.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How many COVID-19 vaccine doses do I need, and how far apart should I get them?
Answer:
Ideally, you’d get:

*   Two doses for the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine, 21 days apart
*   Two doses for the Moderna vaccine, 28 days apart 
*   Just one dose of the Johnson & Johnson/Janssen vaccine.

If two shots are needed, **get your second shot as close to the recommended interval as possible**. If you can’t get it at the recommended interval, you can get your second dose up to 6 weeks (42 days) after the first dose. We have limited data on how well these vaccines work beyond this window. But if you get the second dose after 42 days, there is no need to start over.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I mix and match COVID-19 vaccines from different manufacturers?
Answer: No, you can’t mix and match different vaccines. Be sure to get the same vaccine the second time that you got the first time. COVID-19 vaccines are not interchangeable with each other. The safety and effectiveness of mixing vaccines has not been tested.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How much will the COVID-19 vaccine cost?
Answer:
Nothing. COVID-19 vaccines and their administration are free to the public.

Read more at the Department of Managed Health Care’s [Know Your Health Care Rights (PDF)](https://www.dmhc.ca.gov/Portals/0/Docs/DO/VaccineFactSheetAccessible.pdf).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do I need to be a California resident to get COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer: No. Vaccine eligibility is based on age. Residency or immigration status does not matter.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I cancel or reschedule my vaccine appointment through My Turn?
Answer:
If you need to cancel or reschedule your appointment, you can do so on the [Manage your appointments](https://myturn.ca.gov/manage) page.

You will be asked to confirm your appointment with:

*   Your appointment confirmation number, and 
*   Either your cell phone number or your email address.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: I’ve already had COVID-19. Should I get a COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer: Yes. We do not know how long immunity lasts after recovering from COVID-19.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I get vaccinated against COVID-19 while I am currently sick with COVID-19?
Answer: No. Wait until you have recovered and have met the [criteria for ending isolation](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html). This guidance also applies to people who get COVID-19 between their first and second dose.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will COVID-19 vaccine sites be accessible?
Answer: Yes. All vaccine clinics in California are required to meet ADA requirements.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I get a COVID-19 vaccine at home if I am unable to travel to a vaccine site?
Answer:
Check with your healthcare provider, local health department, or local pharmacy. 

If you cannot leave your home, you can state this when booking on [myturn.ca.gov](http://cert1.mail-west.com/rUyeH/mc7rm/myuzjan/rUgt/dk9o81/erho/nv6ok/51rUaxx) or when calling [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255). If eligible, your local health jurisdiction will arrange for your in-home vaccination.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I get transportation to a vaccine site?
Answer:
If you do not have a way to get to a vaccination site, you can receive free transportation through:

*   [My Turn](http://cert1.mail-west.com/c7rmfWysJ/myuzjanm/fWgt/dk9o81/erho/nv6ok/61fWpjj), or 
*   By calling the state’s COVID-19 hotline at [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255).

Transportation options include:

*   Car transportation for ambulatory patients
*   Non-emergency medical transportation for non-ambulatory patients, including 
    *   Wheelchair vans
    *   Gurney transportation, and other options. 

You can also check with your healthcare provider, local health department, or local pharmacy.

If you have Medi-Cal managed care, you can get transportation through your health plan or provider. Contact your plan’s member service department to ask for transportation.

If you get Medi-Cal through Fee-for-Service (FFS), you can access a list of transportation providers in your county. Contact them directly to arrange transportation to your appointments. 

If there is not a provider in your area, the California Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) can assist. Email them at [DHCSNMT@dhcs.ca.gov](mailto:DHCSNMT@dhcs.ca.gov). Do NOT include personal information in your first email. DHCS staff will reply with a secure email asking for more information. 

If you need non-emergency medical transportation, please inform your medical provider. They can prescribe this service and put you in touch with a transportation service.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will I need a booster vaccination?
Answer:
At this time, there is no change in the recommendations for all eligible Californians to receive a full series of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine (two doses of Moderna or Pfizer, or one dose of Johnson & Johnson). Booster doses are not currently recommended.

CDPH is closely following evolving information about the ability of COVID-19 vaccines to protect against variants. Californians will be able to readily access additional doses at a number of locations should they be recommended in the future.

But additional doses are recommended for people with compromised immune systems, specifically those who: 

*   Get **active cancer treatment** for tumors or cancers of the blood
*   Got an **organ transplant** and are taking medicine to suppress the immune system
*   Got a **stem cell transplant** within the last 2 years or are taking medicine to suppress the immune system
*   Have **moderate or severe primary immunodeficiency** (such as DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome)
*   Have **advanced or untreated HIV infection**
*   Get **active treatment with high-dose corticosteroids** or other drugs that suppress immune response

See [questions and answers about additional doses](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/ThirdVaccineDoseQandA.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: What is acceptable as proof of full vaccination?
Answer:
The following are accepted: 

*   Original DHHS CDC COVID-19 vaccination record card, which includes:
    *   Name of person vaccinated
    *   Date of birth 
    *   Type of vaccine provided
    *   Lot number
    *   Date last dose administered
    *   Site where administered

*   A photo or paper copy of your DHHS CDC COVID-19 vaccination record card
*   A photo of your vaccination record card stored on a phone or other electronic device
*   Paper or digital documentation of vaccination from a healthcare provider or other issuer.
*   A [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (DCVR). 

Read CDPH’s [Vaccine Record Guidelines & Standards](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) for complete details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: What does it mean to be “fully vaccinated”?
Answer:
People are considered fully vaccinated for COVID-19:

*   Two weeks after they receive the second dose in a 2-dose series (Pfizer or Moderna), or
*   Two weeks after they receive a single-dose vaccine (Johnson and Johnson/Janssen).

See CDPH’s [COVID-19 Public Health Recommendations for Fully Vaccinated People](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/COVID-19-Public-Health-Recommendations-for-Fully-Vaccinated-People.aspx) for details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will the COVID-19 vaccine make me test positive for COVID-19?
Answer:
No. A vaccine will not cause you to test positive on [viral tests](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/diagnostic-testing.html).

If your body develops an immune response, you may test positive on [antibody tests](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/serology-overview.html). This shows that you may have protection against the virus.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How is my privacy protected if I take the COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
California law strictly limits how personal information about those who are vaccinated can be shared. California negotiated with the federal government to limit the required data sharing to only information that will not allow an individual to be identified.

Read more at CDPH’s [California Data Use Agreement and Frequently Asked Questions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/California-Data-Use-Agreement.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Should I keep my COVID-19 vaccination record card?
Answer:
Yes. Keep your vaccination record card in a safe place to prevent loss or damage

The [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (DCVR) portal gives you a digital copy of this record. If you’ve lost your paper card, print out your digital record. You can use it at any place where you would show your paper card.

Read CDPH’s [Vaccine Record Guidelines & Standards](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) for complete details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do providers need parental consent before administering  a COVID-19 vaccine to a minor?
Answer:
Yes. Before vaccinating a minor, vaccine providers must get consent from a:

*   Parent, 
*   Legal guardian, or 
*   Other adults having legal custody.. 

There are some exceptions:

*   [Emancipated minors](https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displaySection.xhtml?lawCode=FAM&sectionNum=7050.) do not need the consent of a parent or guardian to receive a COVID-19 vaccine.
*   Providers may accept written consent from a parent or legal guardian of an unaccompanied minor. This consent must verify the parent/guardian has received the [Pfizer EUA Fact Sheet](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download).
*   Phone or video consent is acceptable. The parent/guardian must confirm that they received the [Pfizer EUA Fact Sheet](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download). Reading the fact sheet to the parent/guardian is an option.

Families should check with their vaccine provider on acceptable forms of consent. See CDPH’s [Pfizer Vaccine Minor Consent Guidance](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-Vaccine-Minor-Consent-Guidance.aspx) for more details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Why should I vaccinate my child?
Answer:
Cases in children are increasing. Youth now account for 22% of new COVID-19 cases in the U.S., according to the [American Academy of Pediatrics (PDF)](https://downloads.aap.org/AAP/PDF/AAP%20and%20CHA%20-%20Children%20and%20COVID-19%20State%20Data%20Report%204.29.21%20FINAL.pdf). This time last year it was only around 3%. It is important to get young people vaccinated to prevent new cases from increasing.

Vaccinations may stop the spread of coronavirus variants. They can also shrink the pool of people vulnerable to COVID-19. By getting our 12- to 15-year-olds vaccinated, families can be safer as we get back to doing the things we love.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: My child has had reactions to other vaccines. Should they still get the vaccine?
Answer: Yes, unless they have had anaphylactic-type reactions to components of the Pfizer vaccine. Allergic reactions to the COVID-19 vaccine are rare. If your child has severe allergies or flu vaccine reactions, talk to their doctor before getting them vaccinated. \n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Is there an increased vaccination risk to children who have pre-existing conditions like asthma?
Answer: Youth aged 12 to 15 can still receive the COVID-19 vaccine even if they have health conditions. Talk to your doctor or clinic about your child’s specific conditions.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will my child have to get vaccinated before returning to in-person schooling?
Answer: No. Vaccination isn’t currently required to return to in-person learning. But the state’s goal is to get as many of our 2.1 million 12- to 15-year-olds vaccinated before the new fall term. Vaccination will protect young people against more-contagious coronavirus variants and COVID-19.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Why is the vaccine only for adolescents 12 and over? When will vaccines be available for younger children?
Answer:
Vaccine trials begin with older, more vulnerable populations, then extend to younger ages. Adolescents were the next group prioritized because they are most like adults. Also, they are more likely than younger kids to spread the virus and become seriously ill. This approach balances the need for safety and speed, while protecting our children.

Both Pfizer and Moderna have ongoing clinical trials in kids younger than 12. If all goes well, authorization for this next age group could happen later this year. Johnson & Johnson is currently in clinical trials for the 12-17 age group.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: I’m an employer and want to help my employees get vaccinated. How do I do that?
Answer:
The [Employer Vaccination Toolkit](https://saferatwork.covid19.ca.gov/employer-vaccination-toolkit/) provides all the information you need to:

*   Partner with local providers for offsite vaccination events
*   Request a worksite mobile clinic
*   Help employees find and book vaccination appointments
*   Share and promote resources that support employees in getting vaccinated

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can an employer require COVID-19 vaccination for all employees entering a workplace?
Answer:
Yes, if certain requirements are met. Under the ADA, an employer may insist all employees to meet a standard that is job-related and consistent with business necessity. This could include a safety-related standard requiring COVID-19 vaccination.  

But if an employee cannot meet such a standard because of a disability, the employer may not require that they comply. The exception to that is if the employee’s non-compliance poses a threat to their health or safety or that of others in the workplace.

For more details, read [What You Should Know About COVID-19 and the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, and Other EEO Laws](https://www.eeoc.gov/wysk/what-you-should-know-about-covid-19-and-ada-rehabilitation-act-and-other-eeo-laws).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are people with certain jobs required to be vaccinated?
Answer:
Yes. In California these include healthcare workers, those who work in congregate settings, state employees, and K-12 teachers and school staff.

**Healthcare workers and those who work in congregate settings** (like homeless shelters and correctional facilities) must be fully vaccinated. Exceptions can only be made for those with:

*   Conflicting religious beliefs, or
*   Qualified medical reasons. 

If they are not fully vaccinated, they are required to get tested for COVID-19 regularly and wear masks or other personal protective equipment (PPE) at work. Read more in: 

*   [Health Care Worker Vaccine Requirement Q&A](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/FAQ-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx)
*   [Protection in High-Risk Settings Q&A](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Unvaccinated-Workers-in-High-Risk-Settings-State-Public-Health-Order-FAQ.aspx)

**California state employees** must also be fully vaccinated or be regularly tested for COVID-19. See details at [CalHR’s Vaccine Verification and Testing Requirements (PDF)](https://www.calhr.ca.gov/Documents/Vaccine-Verification-and-Testing-Requirements.pdf).

**K-12 teachers and school employees** in California must [verify that they are fully vaccinated, or be tested weekly](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Vaccine-Verification-for-Workers-in-Schools.aspx) for COVID-19.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: If I get a COVID-19 vaccine, will I still need a flu shot this fall?
Answer: Yes. COVID-19 vaccine does not provide protection against flu.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are there certain populations who should not get a COVID-19 vaccine? What about people with allergies?
Answer:
The [CDC recommends](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html) that:

*   If you have had a severe or immediate reaction to any ingredient in an mRNA COVID-19 vaccine, do not get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine. Ask your doctor if you can get the Janssen vaccine.
*   If you have had a severe or immediate reaction to any ingredient in the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine, do not get the Janssen vaccine. Ask your doctor if you can get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine.
*   If you had an immediate allergic reaction after getting the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, do not get the second dose.  
*   If you are allergic to PEG, you should not get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine. Ask your doctor if you can get the Janssen vaccine.
*   If you are allergic to polysorbate, you should not get the Janssen vaccine. Ask your doctor if you can get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine.

People with underlying medical conditions can get vaccinated, as long as they are not [allergic to vaccine ingredients](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html). Learn more about [vaccination considerations for people with underlying medical conditions](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/underlying-conditions.html).

To learn about the ingredients in authorized COVID-19 vaccines, see

*   [Information about the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Pfizer-BioNTech.html)
*   [Information about the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Moderna.html)
*   [Information About Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/janssen.html)

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: If I’m pregnant or breastfeeding, should I get the COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
Yes. The CDC states that pregnant and lactating individuals can receive a COVID-19 vaccine. Experts have no vaccination safety concerns for pregnant or lactating women or their babies. The COVID-19 vaccines do not contain the live virus, so they cannot cause COVID-19.

Pregnant people are more likely to get severely ill with COVID-19 than those who are not pregnant. Getting a COVID-19 vaccine during pregnancy can protect you from severe illness. Talk to your doctor if you have questions about getting a COVID-19 vaccine.

For more information, read:

*   CDC’s [COVID-19 Vaccines While Pregnant or Breastfeeding](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/pregnancy.html)
*   CDPH’s [COVID-19 Vaccine and Pregnancy (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/COVID-19-Vaccine-and-Pregnancy.pdf)

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How long should I wait to get the vaccine after I’ve had COVID-19?
Answer:
The [CDC recommends:](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fcovid-19%2Finfo-by-product%2Fpfizer%2Fclinical-considerations.html)

*   If you tested positive, had only mild symptoms, and were not treated for the coronavirus, you should:
    *   Wait at least 10 days after the start of COVID-19 symptoms, and 
    *   Meet [criteria to stop isolation](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html) before getting the COVID-19 vaccine.
*   Wait 90 days to get the vaccine if:
    *   You recovered from a COVID-19 infection, and 
    *   Were treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I get a COVID-19 vaccine at the same time as another vaccine?
Answer: Yes, you can get a COVID-19 vaccine and other vaccines (like for the flu) at the same visit. You no longer need to wait 14 days between different vaccinations. Learn more about [getting more than one kind of vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html#Coadministration).\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will I have a choice between the various COVID-19 vaccines?
Answer: Yes. Both [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) and [VaccineFinder](https://vaccinefinder.org/search/) allow you to search for vaccines by manufacturer.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are the COVID-19 vaccines mandatory?
Answer: No. Neither the state or federal government requires you to get vaccinated. We hope Californians will opt for vaccination once they see how safe and effective it is.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do I need to be vaccinated to visit a healthcare facility?
Answer:
Yes. Visitors to hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, and intermediate care facilities must show proof that they are fully vaccinated. If they are not fully vaccinated, they may only visit if they show proof of a negative COVID-19 test within the previous 72 hours.  
  
All visitors, no matter their vaccination status, must wear masks and appropriate PPE and keep social distance during their visit. Read more in CDPH’s [Requirements for Visitors in Acute Health Care and Long-Term Care Settings](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How can I convince my family and friends to take a COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
Talking with family and friends about the benefits of getting a COVID-19 vaccine can be hard. Try to listen without judgement and identify the root of their concerns. Things to remember to help open the discussion include:

*   Listen to questions with empathy
*   Ask open-ended questions to explore concerns
*   Ask permission to share information
*   Help them find their own reason to get vaccinated
*   Help make their vaccination happen

Read the CDC’s [How to talk about COVID-19 vaccines with friends and family](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/talk-about-vaccines.html?ACSTrackingID=USCDC_2067-DM52837&ACSTrackingLabel=How%20to%20Talk%20to%20Family%20and%20Friends%20about%20COVID-19%20Vaccines%20%7C%20COVID-19&deliveryName=USCDC_2067-DM52837).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are vaccines safe for our youth ages 12 to 15?
Answer: Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine is [authorized by the FDA](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use) for kids aged 12 and up. It was found to be safe and effective in protecting children as young as 12 in clinical trials.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do COVID-19 vaccines work?
Answer: COVID-19 vaccines teach our immune systems how to fight the virus that causes COVID-19. It takes a few weeks after vaccination for the body to build immunity against the virus. That means it is possible you could still get COVID-19 just after vaccination. \n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How long will the incentive cards last? When will the program run out?
Answer: Cards were only available for the first 2 million eligible individuals who started their vaccination process between May 27 and July 18.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: If I got my first dose before the incentive card program started, then get my second dose after it started, am I eligible?
Answer: No, you were not eligible to receive an incentive card. But you were eligible for the other cash and vacation prizes. The purpose of the card program was to motivate unvaccinated Californians to get vaccinated.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Can I get the $50 incentive card if I completed my vaccination before the program started?
Answer: No. The incentive card program was intended to motivate the remaining Californians to get vaccinated. However, fully vaccinated Californians were eligible for other cash and vacation prizes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How do I get my redemption code?
Answer:
If you started your vaccination between May 27 and July 18, you’ll get a redemption code by text or email within 7-10 days after your last vaccination. For those receiving a two-dose series, your $50 card will be set aside until your completed second dose.

*   If you do not have a mobile phone or email address, then 7-10 days after your vaccination, you can call [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873) to receive a physical card.
*   If you don’t have a permanent address, then 7-10 days after your vaccination, call [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873) to coordinate delivery of your $50 card.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How long after redeeming the incentive card does it take to receive it?
Answer: It takes up to five business days to receive the incentive card. If you have not received your card after five business days, call [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How will people prove they’ve had both doses? What if someone tries to cheat with a fake vaccine card?
Answer: COVID-19 vaccines are tracked in California immunization records. Incentive cards and other cash prizes will be awarded based on those records.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What if I got vaccinated, but did not receive my code?
Answer: If you do not receive a code after 14 days, call [1-833-993-3873](tel:1-833-993-3873).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Is there a choice of incentive cards?
Answer:
Yes, there are three choices:

1.  Virtual Mastercard®: Not an ATM card so it cannot be cashed out. It can be redeemed online where Debit Mastercard® is accepted. This is a virtual incentive card and can be added to a phone mobile wallet.
2.  Kroger: Good at Ralphs, Food 4 Less and Foods Co. We recommend printing the card, as not all grocery stores can scan it on a phone. _(Note: Some Food 4 Less stores in Northern California and the Central Coast do not accept this card as payment. _Check this_ [_list of participating Kroger locations_ (PDF)](https://files.covid19.ca.gov/pdf/Ralphs-Food4Less-FoodsCo-CA-list.pdf)_._)_
3.  Albertsons: Good at Safeway, Albertsons, Vons, Pavilions, and Andronico's Community Markets. We recommend printing the card, as not all grocery stores can scan it on a phone.

Available while supplies last. If you are younger than 18, you will need to have a parent or guardian complete the card selection process for you, unless you are an emancipated minor.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Does my redemption code ever expire?
Answer: Yes. You must use the redemption code within 90 days to claim your card. Once claimed, the Virtual Mastercard® expires after 12 months. The grocery cards never expire.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What did I need to do to enter the drawings?
Answer: You just had to get vaccinated in California for COVID-19 before winners were drawn. No entry form was needed; you were automatically entered in the drawing based on California immunization records once your vaccinator provided the state vaccination registry with your information. Vaccinations counted whether you got the Pfizer, Moderna, or Johnson & Johnson vaccine. You must be living in California to win. Winner gets the prize after they complete their vaccination series.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How do I book a COVID-19 vaccination appointment?
Answer: You can schedule appointments or find walk-in clinics at [myturn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov). You can also use other websites or hotlines provided by the CDC or local health departments. Appointments can also be made by calling the California COVID-19 Hotline at [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What if I get vaccinated outside of California’s My Turn system?
Answer: You do not need to vaccinate through My Turn to be eligible. You are still eligible if your vaccination site is in California and reports doses given to the state.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What if I opted to not share my data with the Immunization Information Systems (IIS)?
Answer: The data is still reported to the state, so you would still be eligible for the incentive and other cash prizes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How were winners notified?
Answer:
The state protects your privacy, and has taken steps to protect Californians against scams. The winners were notified by officials from the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) through official "State of CA CDPH" caller ID, text, CDPH email address, or in person by CDPH district staff. Only CDPH knows the identity of the person associated with the random number that has been drawn. For more information, see the [Terms and Conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vax-Win-Terms.aspx).

Winners were not asked to pay any fees associated with verifying eligibility for the cash prize. Any fraudulent activities or misinformation should be reported to [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) or [1-833-993-3873](tel:833-993-3873). Individuals can use this email address or phone number to report any concerns about the authenticity of any contact they have received related to cash prizes.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Did you make public the names of winners?
Answer: At the time of the drawing, no names were announced. Winners can decline the prize, or decline publicity associated with the prize.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Does a person need to be a U.S. citizen to win?
Answer:
No. Eligibility was not determined by immigration status. Those eligible to win must only meet the following criteria:

*   Live in California,
*   Are aged 12 and older,
*   And received at least a first dose of their COVID-19 vaccine.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Who was not eligible?
Answer:
You were not eligible if you are:

*   An employee of certain government agencies or their immediate family member, 
*   Incarcerated,
*   Live outside of California, or
*   Got vaccinated outside of California. 

Prize money will be paid after the winner completes their vaccination series.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: I got a call about Vax for the Win that seemed fraudulent. What should I do?
Answer:
Winners were notified by the California Department of Public Health and were not be asked to pay any fees associated with verifying eligibility for the cash prize.

Any fraudulent activities or misinformation can be reported to [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) or [1-833-993-3873](tel:833-993-3873). Individuals should also use this email address or phone number to report any concerns about the authenticity of any contact they have received related to cash prizes.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Is personal health information shared through these vaccine incentive programs?
Answer:
No, Californians' personal health information is not shared by these programs. The Lottery will assist the programs, but will not receive personally-identifiable information. All entries will be anonymous to them.

The names of winners won't be disclosed without their consent. However, the county of the winner could be announced. The state will ensure the drawings are fair, honest, legal, and protective of personal information.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Who pays for this program?
Answer: This program is being paid for by the State of California.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How will the prize money be paid?
Answer: All prize money is subject to taxation and will be paid by the State Controller’s Office. The prize money will also be subject to any back taxes, child support payments, or liens owed by the winner.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How will the Dream Vacations be disbursed?
Answer:
After a winner accepted the Dream Vacation, their name and contact information was provided to the organizer of that trip. The organizer served as the travel liaison for the winner. The organizer contacted the winner within five business days of them accepting the prize to provide details on redeeming the Dream Vacation. 

The organizing companies are:

*   [Visit California](http://www.visitcalifornia.com/)
*   [San Francisco Travel Association](https://www.sftravel.com/)
*   [Greater Palm Springs Convention & Visitors Bureau](https://www.visitgreaterpalmsprings.com/)
*   [Visit Anaheim](https://www.visitanaheim.org/)
*   [Los Angeles Tourism & Convention Board](https://www.discoverlosangeles.com/)
*   [San Diego Tourism Authority](https://www.sandiego.org/)

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Is there a choice of Dream Vacations?
Answer:
No, one winner was chosen for each of six trips:

*   San Francisco (4 people for 5 nights)
*   Greater Palm Springs (2 people for 2 nights)
*   Anaheim/Orange County (4 people for 6 nights)
*   Los Angeles (4 people for 3 nights)
*   San Diego Beach (4 people for 5 nights)
*   San Diego Downtown (4 people for 5 nights)

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Do the Dream Vacations expire?
Answer:
Yes. 

The Anaheim/Orange County Dream Vacation and the San Diego Dream Vacations must be used by May 31, 2022. 

The San Francisco, Greater Palm Springs and Los Angeles Dream Vacations must be used by June 15, 2022.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Are the Dream Vacations taxable?
Answer: Yes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How many free tickets are available and who is eligible?
Answer: Six Flags is donating 50,000 free tickets to any Californian who receives their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccination at participating providers starting June 16, while supplies last.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Which parks are eligible?
Answer: The tickets will be eligible at any of the four Six Flags parks in California - Six Flags Magic Mountain, Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Los Angeles, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, and Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Concord.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How will I receive my ticket?
Answer: Paper tickets will be provided at the provider’s location at the time of vaccination.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Which providers are distributing tickets and how can I get an appointment?
Answer: There are 65 vaccination brick-and-mortar locations and a number of vaccination pop-up sites which will be giving away the tickets through 14 provider organizations. The organizations distributing tickets are the Center for Family Health and Education, the Chinatown Service Center, Clinica Sierra Vista, Community Medical Centers, Elica Health Centers, the JWCH Institute, Lifelong Health, UCI Family Health, Tiburcio Vasquez Health Centers, and St. John’s Well Child and Family Centers. Kaiser Permanente, Dignity Health, Curative, and Color Health will also be distributing tickets in select locations. The counties covered by the site service areas include Alameda, Contra Costa, Kern, Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside, Sacramento, San Bernardino, San Joaquin, Solano, Tulare, Ventura, Yolo, and Yuba. See the [full list of participating locations](/vax-for-the-win-six-flags).\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: When did participating providers begin distributing tickets?
Answer: Participating providers began distributing tickets to newly-vaccinated people beginning on Wednesday, June 16th following the announcement by Governor Gavin Newsom.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What are the terms and conditions of the tickets?
Answer: Tickets are valid until September 6th at any of the four Six Flags parks in California - Six Flags Magic Mountain, Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Los Angeles, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, and Six Flags Hurricane Harbor Concord. Tickets are non-transferrable and not available for resale. Any attempt to resell tickets will result in a deactivation of the ticket.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Có bảng dữ liệu nào cho thấy tiến triển của California trong việc cho dùng vắc-xin COVID-19 không?
Answer: Có. Quý vị có thể [tìm thấy bảng này trên trang Dữ liệu tiến trình tiêm vắc-xin của chúng tôi](/vi/vaccination-progress-data).\n\nMore info: [Dữ liệu và công cụ](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/data-and-tools/)

Question: Tôi có thể tìm danh sách các lĩnh vực hạ tầng quan trọng thiết yếu ở đâu?
Answer: Truy cập [Lực lượng lao động thiết yếu](/vi/essential-workforce/) để tìm hiểu những lĩnh vực và đối tượng người lao động nào được đưa vào danh sách.\n\nMore info: [Lực lượng lao động thiết yếu](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/essential-workforce/)<!-- non-essential, non-critical -->

Question: Chương trình bảo hiểm y tế của tôi có bao trả cho dịch vụ xét nghiệm COVID-19 tại địa điểm xét nghiệm không?
Answer:
Có. [Hướng dẫn của liên bang (PDF)](https://www.dmhc.ca.gov/Portals/0/Docs/DO/APL21-011-NewFederalGuidanceRegardingCOVID-19Testing.pdf) yêu cầu các chương trình bảo hiểm y tế xét nghiệm miễn phí cho mọi người. Quý vị không nhất thiết phải có các triệu chứng hoặc đã phơi nhiễm COVID-19. Quý vị không nhất thiết phải là “người lao động trong các ngành nghề thiết yếu” mới được xét nghiệm.

Để được xét nghiệm, quý vị có thể tới bất kỳ nhà cung cấp dịch vụ xét nghiệm COVID-19 nào được tiểu bang ủy quyền hoặc cấp phép. Quý vị không cần phải đến nhà cung cấp trong mạng lưới nhà cung cấp thuộc chương trình bảo hiểm y tế hay công ty bảo hiểm y tế của mình. Quý vị không cần xin phép chương trình bảo hiểm y tế hay công ty bảo hiểm y tế của mình trước khi đến xét nghiệm COVID-19. Và quý vị không cần thanh toán khoản đồng trả cho xét nghiệm COVID-19.

More info: [Testing](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/get-tested/)

Question: Tôi nên làm gì nếu tôi không có bảo hiểm y tế và tôi cần nhận dịch vụ chăm sóc hoặc xét nghiệm COVID-19?
Answer: Đối với những người không có bảo hiểm, [chính phủ chi trả](https://www.hrsa.gov/CovidUninsuredClaim) tất cả các chi phí chăm sóc và xét nghiệm COVID-19 cần thiết. Hãy kiểm tra các triệu chứng của quý vị thông qua chức năng [Sàng Lọc Triệu Chứng](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/symptoms.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fsymptoms-testing%2Findex.html) hoặc trao đổi với bác sĩ của quý vị.\n\nMore info: [Testing](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/get-tested/)

Question: Mất bao lâu để có kết quả xét nghiệm vi-rút corona?
Answer:
Thời gian có kết quả xét nghiệm vi-rút corona thường dưới hai ngày. Khoảng hai phần ba kết quả được trả lại trong vòng một ngày và hơn 85% kết quả được trả lại trong vòng hai ngày.

Thời gian có kết quả xét nghiệm này tính cả thời gian giao kết quả. Đối với các phòng xét nghiệm xử lý bộ dụng cụ xét nghiệm tại nhà, thời gian có kết quả xét nghiệm tùy thuộc vào thời điểm quý vị gửi lại bộ dụng cụ của mình qua đường bưu điện.

Nếu quý vị chưa nhận được kết quả xét nghiệm của mình và đã nhiều ngày trôi qua, hãy liên hệ:
